newsitem.title: UK: Analysts pleased with BP results.
newsitem.headline: Analysts pleased with BP results.

text.p: The results of British Petroleum may have appeared slightly disappointing at first sight, but a closer look shows that profits were in line with market expectations, analysts said.
BP earlier reported that fourth quarter replacement cost net profit rose to 689 million stg from 510 million stg a year ago.
The result, which was before execptional items, came in below a consensus forecast of 710 million stg and added extra pressure to already weak BP shares.
But, after sifting through BP's statement, analysts said the fourth quarter results were clouded by "unusual" charges in the upstream sector.
The charges, which were not considered exceptional by BP, amounted to about 60 million stg.
"The figures were fine if you take into account these charges," said Nick Antill at BZW.
BP shares were down 25-1/2 pence at 695-1/2 in late afternoon trade.
The stocks had come under early pressure following weak oil prices, which had triggered profit-taking. But the further drop after the results release was overdone, analysts said.
"It's a bit of an overreaction. People have to look through the results," said Paul Spedding at Kleinwort Benson.
